exceptions.exn: Cannot coerce app_mono to an evaluable reference.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T3: poset
T2: poset
T1: poset
f1: T2 -> T1
f2: T3 -> T2
s: chain T3
M1: monotone f1
M2: monotone f2

Goal:
[f1^^[f2^^sbyM2]byM1] = [f1 \o f2^^sbycomp_mono M1 M2]

Premises:
monotone : forall T1 T2 : poset, (T1 -> T2) -> Prop
Record chain (T : poset) : Type := Chain { pred_of : Pred T; _ : chain_axiom pred_of } Arguments Chain [T pred_of]
app_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [T1 : poset T2 : poset T3 : poset f1 : T2 -> T1 f2 : T3 -> T2 s : chain T3 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 |- Type] ?T : [T1 : poset T2 : poset T3 : poset f1 : T2 -> T1 f2 : T3 -> T2 s : chain T3 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 |- poset]
dapp_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [T1 : poset T2 : poset T3 : poset f1 : T2 -> T1 f2 : T3 -> T2 s : chain T3 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 |- Type] ?T : [T1 : poset T2 : poset T3 : poset f1 : T2 -> T1 f2 : T3 -> T2 s : chain T3 M1 : monotone f1 M2 : monotone f2 |- ?A -> poset]
comp_mono = fun (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (x y : T3) (H : x <== y) => M1 (f2 x) (f2 y) (M2 x y H) : forall (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2), monotone f1 -> monotone f2 -> monotone (f1 \o f2) Arguments comp_mono {T1 T2 T3} {f1 f2}%function_scope
image_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain T1 -> forall f : T1 -> T2, monotone f -> chain T2
image_chainP : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (s : chain T1) (f : T1 -> T2), monotone f -> chain_axiom [Pred x2 | exists x1 : T1, x2 = f x1 /\ x1 \In s]
const_chain : forall T2 : poset, T2 -> chain T2
map_comp : forall (T1 T2 T3 : Type) (f1 : T2 -> T3) (f2 : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq (f1 \o f2) i | i <- s] = [seq f1 i | i <- [seq f2 i | i <- s]]
id_chainE : forall (T : poset) (s : chain T) (M : monotone id), [id^^sbyM] = s
tarski_lfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_lfp f) = tarski_lfp f
tarski_gfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_gfp f) = tarski_gfp f
const_mono = fun (T1 T2 : poset) (y : T2) (x y0 : T1) => fun=> poset_refl y : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (y : T2), monotone (fun=> y) Arguments const_mono {T1 T2 y}
pairPoset = fun A B : poset => Poset.Pack {| Poset.mixin := pairPosetMixin A B |} (A * B) : poset -> poset -> poset
phant_id : forall T1 T2 : Type, T1 -> T2 -> Prop
compA : forall (A B C D : Type) (h : A -> B) (g : B -> C) (f : C -> D), (f \o g) \o h = f \o (g \o h)
funPoset = fun (A : Type) (B : poset) => Poset.Pack {| Poset.mixin := funPosetMixin A B |} (A -> B) : Type -> poset -> poset Arguments funPoset _%type_scope
dfunPoset : forall A : Type, (A -> poset) -> poset
Poset.Pack : forall sort : Type, Poset.class_of sort -> Type -> poset
map = fun (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) => fix map (s : seq T1) : seq T2 := match s with | [::] => [::] | x :: s' => f x :: map s' end : forall T1 T2 : Type, (T1 -> T2) -> seq T1 -> seq T2 Arguments map {T1 T2}%type_scope _%function_scope _%seq_scope
prod_mono = fun (S1 S2 T1 T2 : poset) (f1 : S1 -> T1) (f2 : S2 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (__top_assumption_ : pairPoset S1 S2) => (fun _evar_0_ : forall (a : S1) (b : S2), (fun p : S1 * S2 => forall y : pairPoset S1 S2, p <== y -> (f1 \* f2) p <== (f1 \* f2) y) (a, b) => let (x, x0) as p return ((fun p0 : S1 * S2 => forall y : pairPoset S1 S2, p0 <== y -> (f1 \* f2) p0 <== (f1 \* f2) y) p) := __top_assumption_ in _evar_0_ x x...
eq_comp : forall (A B C : Type) (f f' : B -> A) (g g' : C -> B), f =1 f' -> g =1 g' -> f \o g =1 f' \o g'
can_comp : forall (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (h : C -> B) (f' : A -> B) (h' : B -> C), cancel f f' -> cancel h h' -> cancel (f \o h) (h' \o f')
const_chainE : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (y : T2) (s : chain T1), [fun=> y^^sbyconst_mono] = const_chain y
pred_of : forall T : poset, chain T -> Pred T
idealPoset : forall T : poset, T -> poset
Poset.sort = fun t : poset => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : poset -> Type Poset.sort is a coercion
subPoset : forall T : poset, Pred T -> poset
inj_comp : forall (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (h : C -> B), injective f -> injective h -> injective (f \o h)
bij_comp : forall (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (h : C -> B), bijective f -> bijective h -> bijective (f \o h)
Chain : forall (T : poset) (pred_of : Pred T), chain_axiom pred_of -> chain T
ssr.ssrfun.inj_compr : forall (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (h : C -> B), injective (f \o h) -> injective h

```coq
unfold app_mono, dapp_mono, comp_mono.
rewrite image_chainP.
rewrite map_comp.
apply eq_comp.
- apply func_ext_sequential.
  intro x.
  apply func_ext_sequential.
  intro y.
  unfold compose, app_mono, dapp_mono.
  rewrite <- id_chainE.
  reflexivity.
- apply func_ext_sequential.
  intro x.
  apply func_ext_sequential.
  intro y.
  unfold compose, app_mono, dapp_mono.
  rewrite <- id_chainE.
  reflexivity.
Qed.```
